newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank to grant metal firms more loans.
newsitem.headline: China bank to grant metal firms more loans.

text.p: The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) will grant additional loans of 3.8 billion yuan ($457.8 million) to 30 key metal enterprises in the second half of 1996, the Financial News said on Wednesday.
The newspaper did not give the total loans to be granted during the period.
In the first half, the ICBC granted new working capital loans totalling 6.0 billion yuan to more than 1,600 metallurgy enterprises with good credit rating, it said.
Outstanding working capital loans granted by the bank to the enterprises totalled 82.1 billion yuan by the end of June, it said.
The Anshan, Baoshan and Wuhan steel plants had so far received 1.4 billion yuan, 500 million yuan and 600 million yuan respectively in working capital loans from ICBC, it said.
